title: Ticket #2537: Procd / Master crash on MacOS in batlabs
description:
For the longest time, the mac machine in old batlab would stop running jobs, roughly once a week. We now see the problem in the new batlab.

The master crashes with the following stack trace (c++filt doesn't seem to help)

Indeed, the watchdog pipe isn't there, but the procd process itself is running.
remarks:
2011-Oct-27 14:40:52 by jfrey:
Some additional investigation:

When the master crashes, it's restarted almost immediately by the launchd. The procd is restarted shortly thereafter. The procd has the missing watchdog pipe open, so it must have been unlinked after the procd was started.

When the procd starts, it unlinks the watchdog pipe filename, then recreates it, then opens both ends. On shutdown, it unlinks the filename. So if the old procd stayed alive until after the new one was started, it would have taken out the new procd's pipe when it finally exited.

2013-May-23 11:43:56 by jfrey:
The cause of this problem has been diagnosed and fixed (#3617).
